alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 10:20AM CDT until August 25 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 1020 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes along Wolf Creek near Elberta where rises of several feet have occurred this morning and additional heavy rain may exacerbate flooding in areas near Wolf Creek. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gulf Shores, Foley, Orange Beach, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour, Elberta, Fort Morgan, Gasque, Gulf Highlands and Miflin. This includes the following streams and drainages... Owens Bayou, Fish River, Noltie Creek, Weeks Creek, Weeks Branch, Gulf of Mexico, Mobile Bay, Eslava Branch, Magnolia River, Perdido Bay, Sandy Creek, Schoolhouse Branch, Wolf Creek and Skunk Bayou. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
